title: Gruszecki
text:
Gruszecki (, sometimes anglicized as Grushetsky) is a <a href="Poles">Polish</a>, <a href="Ukrainians">Ukrainian</a> and <a href="Russians">Russian</a> surname. The name originates from the <a href="knight">knight</a> Maciej – <a href="Chor%C4%85%C5%BCy">Chorąży</a> of the <a href="King%20of%20Poland">King of Poland</a> <a href="Jogaila">Jogaila</a>. The King had given to him village <a href="Gruszka%20Du%C5%BCa">Gruszka Duża</a>, in eastern <a href="Poland">Poland</a>, in favor of knightly merit, in 1411. 
The Gruszecki family name was derived from the village of Gruszka Duża.
